description: Oksana Lintz, after deliberation, decides to leak the Council's entire encrypted BCI corruption archive. She prepares anonymous release protocols to avoid immediate detection.
Anonymous files with decades of secret Council records, BCI compliance manipulation, and privilege abuses leak online. Oksana quietly confirms her role to trusted allies within oversight circles.
Widespread outrage sweeps Stenograd as citizens verify the leaked records. Council officials face mass resignations and angry crowds block their access to public spaces and services.
Spontaneous public assemblies debate new governance models. Community leaders, including former BCI 'ghosts,' call for direct and transparent systems to replace the Council.
Citizens adopt rotating councils chosen by public lottery, emphasizing transparency and inclusion. Marginalized voices gain guiding roles in shaping a radically new civic order.
